* Work closely with Product Management and other stakeholders to plan and execute successful product launches.
* Translate new features and capabilities into customer-facing communications in order to increase customer and market adoption.
* Dive into the win /loss analysis and pull out clear opportunities for future growth and changes to our product direction and sales messaging.
* Own end-to-end product launches including defining the go-to-market plans, sales enablement tools, and marketing activation in collaboration with our sales, customer success and marketing teams.
* Be a strong stakeholder to Product department who owns Profit responsibility for self-service customers
* Lead and coach our Lifecycle Marketing team, currently consisting of 4
* Part of the Marketing Leadership Team
* Drive adoption & implementation of the product marketing charter



  





**Required Experiences** 



* Proven track record of leading high-performing Product Marketing teams in fast-growing companies.
* Successful experience in rolling out product go-to-market strategies.
* An understanding and experience of working with lifecycle marketing
* Ability to turn analysis into actionable insights and clear recommendations.
* Passion for user education, research, content, and business.
* Strong project management skills, used to leading complex projects
* Proficiency in marketing tech stack tools (e.g. Mixpanel, Intercom, Split.io , Customer.io , Metabase), CRM (e.g., Salesforce), Marketing Automation Tools (e.g., Pardot, Hubspot, Braze) as well as proficiency in marketing project management tools such as Asana or Monday.com .
* Strong stakeholder management and cross-functional collaboration skills.
* A proven track record of making strategic decisions and successfully executing them in a fast-moving environment



  





**The Ideal Applicant Will Have** 



* Experience from SaaS preferably one with a product-first go-to-market
* Experience from SaaS with a land-and-expand business model
* Experience with product marketing partnerships



  





 You don't have to know Swedish (daily work is carried out in English and the Mentimeter team currently boasts over 50+ different nationalities!
 



  





 The role is based in our Stockholm office and is primarily an onsite role.
 



 Learn more about Our Ways of Working - Guiding Principles by clicking here .
 



  





 Not sure you meet 100% of our qualifications?
 



 Please apply anyway and let us know why you would enjoy working in this role at Mentimeter!
 



  





**What Mentimeter Can Offer** 




 At Mentimeter we can offer a diverse and inclusive work environment supported by smart and driven colleagues. We believe in continuous professional development for all of our colleagues and therefore offer access to a leadership program (including external personal coach) and relevant education to ensure that we continue to be state-of-the-art when it comes to innovating and building Mentimeter. Your place will be in a growing company with lots of career opportunities, working on a beloved product used by more than 300 million people. It’s not all about work though, we also offer a very healthy view on work-life balance.
 



 All of this comes attached with a competitive compensation and benefits package, including pension contributions. Once a year we also relocate to exciting places all over the world like Merida & Buenos Aires for our Toronto colleagues, cities in Europe (for our Stockholm colleagues), and cities in APAC (for our Sydney colleagues), paid for by us of course. Learn more about our benefits by visiting our Benefits & Perks page
 



  





**Culture at Mentimeter** 




 At Mentimeter we believe in giving everyone a voice - regardless of who you are. So we build a platform that does just that. Our platform is not only our product but also our organization. A platform where people feel safe, where differences are embraced, a place where you can have fun. We strongly encourage applicants who are people of color, LGBTQ+, women, people with disabilities, and/or formerly incarcerated people, and a college degree is not strictly required. In order to give everyone a voice, we need to be as diverse as our users.
 



 Learn more about our culture by visiting our Culture page .
 



 Review our Privacy Policy for more information.

title: Partner Manager
description:
Do you want to be part of a leading Nordic scaleup whilst contributing to the global corporate sustainability transition? Position Green is in a strong scaleup phase and we are now looking for a Partner Manager to scale our sales through commercial partnerships in Europe and the US.
   

  

 Position Green is a leading pure play sustainability partner with a mission to revolutionise how businesses integrate sustainability. Through our SaaS software and strategic advisory, Position Green’s offering makes sustainability actionable and measurable. We support businesses in fast-tracking their compliance with increasing regulation whilst also strengthening their competitiveness and sustainability impact. We come from the Nordics but we operate across the globe in supporting our customers to navigate and succeed in corporate sustainability.
   

  

 We see increasing potential in strategic partnerships and are now excited to offer the position as Partner Manager, with the ambition to scale our commercial progress even further in both existing and new markets.
   

  

 Are you a seasoned professional with a proven track record in building successful commercial partnerships? Are you ready to develop and manage partnerships? If so, we want you to join us as our Partner Manager.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As Partner Manager, you will play a key role in establishing and nurturing strategic partnerships that contribute to revenue growth and enhance our ability to make a positive impact on businesses and organizations. Reporting directly to the Partnership Director, you will support the partnership strategy and work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Support the partnership strategy realization to scale our capabilities in selling and implementing sustainability software across existing and new markets.
* Identify, evaluate, and manage partnerships with key players.
* Collaborate closely with the Sales and Customer Success teams to ensure successful implementation and ongoing satisfaction of partners and customers.
* Stay updated on industry trends and competitive landscape to identify new opportunities and potential risks.


**Are you the one we're looking for?**
 To excel in this role, you should have:
   

  

* 3-5 years of experience in B2B sales, preferably within a Saas environment
* Demonstrated success in developing and maintaining strategic relationships.
* Entrepreneurial mindset and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* Excellent communication and negotiation skills.
* Fluent in English; German proficiency is a plus.
* Experience in building and managing commercial partnerships in a SaaS environment is highly meritorious


**What We Offer**
 Join Position Green and become an integral part of our fast-paced, fun, and impactful scale-up environment. Enjoy the opportunity for personal and professional growth, where your contributions make a real difference in driving sustainable transformation.
   

  

**We provide**
**Competitive Compensation And Benefits Package.**
* Wellness allowance to support your health and well-being.
* 30 vacation days plus 5 extra days.
* Flexible working hours and a hybrid work option.


**Location**
 We prefer candidates based in Malmö, Stockholm or Brussels.
   

  

 If you are passionate about sustainability, have a proven track record in building successful partnerships, and are ready to make a meaningful impact, we want to hear from you. Apply now and be a driving force in shaping the future of Position Green!
   

  

**What’s next?**
 If this sounds like a great opportunity for you, we will be happy to receive your CV. In this recruitment, great importance is placed on personal suitability.
   

  

 The start date of this position is September 2nd 2024. We will be reviewing applications on a continuous basis and looking forward to your application.
   

  

* Position Green Group is the Nordic leader in sustainability software and consulting.
* Supports 500+ customers worldwide.
* 300+ employees with expertise within strategy, communication, software development, environmental studies, engineering and social sciences.
* Awarded and recognized as one of the leading tech scaleups in the Nordics by Techarenan, Deloitte, Norrsken Impact Summit, Cleantech Scandinavia and Breakit.

title: Data Engineer
description:
**B3 Business Transformation söker engagerade och drivna Data Engineers som vill vara en del av ett härligt och kompetent team och som vill utvecklas tillsammans med oss.**
 Vi på B3 Business Transformation stärker våra kunders digitala konkurrenskraft genom att vara datadrivna i sina processer, analyser och vid beslutsfattande. Med vår kompetens inom Advanced Analytics, Data Warehouse, Business Intelligence i kombination med stor affärsförståelse leder vi våra kunder in i ett datadrivet arbetssätt och möjliggör utveckling av nya digitala initiativ och etablering av moderna arbetssätt. Så varför inte ta chansen att bli en del av ett kompetent team som drivs av utveckling, samhörighet och energi.
   

  

**Om rollen:**
 Som konsult hos oss ges du möjligheter till intressanta uppdrag hos en mängd olika spännande kunder. Att du har förmågan att skapa relationer och på ett prestigelöst sätt samarbeta i team tror vi är avgörande för att du ska lyckas i ditt uppdrag. Som Data Engineer är ditt fokus att designa, modellera, utveckla datalager och integrationsflöden från en eller flera olika källsystem, för att lagra data i strukturerade eller semistrukturerade datakällor. Du arbetar självständigt eller tillsammans med kompetenta kollegor, där ni formar en effektiv informationslösning vilket är en förutsättning för att skapa ett bestående datadrivet arbetssätt hos kunden.
   

  

**Ett CV säger inte allt men vi** 
 ser att du har följande kvalifikationer:
   

  

* Du har minst 3 års erfarenhet från att ha arbetat som Data Engineer.
* Du har erfarenhet av flera olika moderna ramverk och utvecklarverktyg för t.ex ETL/ELT-flöden, Databaser, Data Warehouse, DataLake, Datamodellering och DevOps.
* Du har erfarenhet av att ha arbetat i en eller flera molnplattformar – Azure, AWS, GCP.
* Det är meriterade om du har arbetat som konsult
* Du arbetar obehindrat på svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift.


**Vi erbjuder:**
* Attraktiv lönemodell.
* Goda förutsättningar för flexibla arbetstider.
* Möjligheter att gå relevanta utbildningar och ta attraktiva certifikat.
* Multi cloud-satsning.
* Bra ramavtal och en stark säljorganisation som skapar förutsättningar för många spännande uppdrag.
* En fantastisk wellness- och medarbetarsatsning. Läs mer här


 B3 Business Transformation är en del av B3 Consulting Group, ett av Sveriges snabbast växande företag inom IT och management. Således kan vi erbjuda det bästa av två världar. Styrkan hos ett stort börsnoterat bolag i kombination med den härliga samhörigheten som ett mindre bolag erbjuder.
   

  

 Vi är även stolta över att vi vann priset som ”Årets Karriärföretag” 2022 och kom på tredje plats som Sveriges bästa bolag enligt ”Great Place to Work 2021”. Vi tror att det beror på vår energi, vårt sätt att välkomna olikheter och våra erfarenheter som vi gärna delar med oss av. En central del av energiskapandet är vår unika wellness-satsning Team B3. Vi tror att medarbetare som mår bra, presterar bra och vill vara engagerade kollegor och goda medmänniskor. Det är även viktigt för oss att ge dig möjligheter till att löpande utbilda och certifiera dig inom relevanta områden för att du ska känna att du utvecklas och ökar ditt marknadsvärde.
   

  

 De som jobbar kvar hos oss efter många år pratar om friheten att påverka sina uppdrag, arbetstider och utveckling. De talar även om stoltheten över att vara en del av ett bolag som inte bara levererar förstklassigt resultat till sina kunder utan även tar ansvar för samhället i stort bl.a. genom att vara partner till fina initiativ som Women in Tech, Changers Hub, Pink Programming m.fl.
   

  

**Kontakt:**
 Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig, så ansök redan idag.
   

  

 Vi tar inte emot ansökningar via mail, men har du någon fråga är du mer än välkommen att höra av dig till Talent Acquisition Partner marcus.krebs@b3.se

title: AI Backend Developer
description:
Are you looking for a role within an exciting world of AI technologies, where you can both contribute with your expertise and keep on developing?
   

  

 We are starting a new chapter within ASSA ABLOY’s organization, and we are looking for top talent to help us grow our AI Technical Development Teams from scratch.
   

  

 Join our Team in Stockholm, Sweden and enjoy a collaborative culture that empowers you to build a career you can be proud of.
   

  

**What Would You Do As Our AI Backend Developer**
 You would be a leading AI Backend Developer in our new project that deals with AI Technical Development, working with our new Team of Engineers in Stockholm. We have cross-functional teams that create modern, secure and high-quality solutions. We develop embedded applications and connect them with Mobile Applications, Electronic Access Control software using cloud and microservice architecture.
   

  

**You would also:**
* stay up to date with the latest AI technologies
* be responsible for hands-on RND Development including Cloud infrastructure development, DevOps, Databases and security
* interact with tech- and non-tech stakeholders


**The Skills And Experience You Need**
 We are looking for someone who:
   

  

* has previous experience in building both backend applications and cloud infrastructure
* understands AI solutions and knows how to use them
* has experience with Microservices, Docker & Containers, as well as databases
* has experience for working in a DevOps team, within an agile environment
* is fluent in English, spoken and written


 Our code is written in Python – hands-on experience with Python will be beneficial but isn’t a must-have.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 We’re passionate about providing amazing opportunities and benefits, so you can continue and progress a lifelong career with us – here’s what we have to offer:
   

  

* Learning and career development opportunities, whether it’s online learning, management training or enhancing your skills.
* A competitive salary and incentive schemes.
* Hybrid model of working.
* Flexible working hours.
* Stable employment in a friendly international atmosphere.


**We review applications regularly, so don’t wait**
 We are building diverse, inclusive teams, and encourage applications from everyone who can see themselves working with us. Just set up your profile and apply here, no later than 30th June 2024.
   

  

 To make sure your personal data is safe, we don’t look at any applications sent by email or post. If you have any questions about the role or the process, email Khalil Kabakibi, Talent Acquisition Business Partner, at khalil.kabakibi@assaabloy.com.
   

  

 Let’s create a safer and more open world - together!
   

  

 To find out more about us, visit www.assaabloy.com
   

  

**We are the ASSA ABLOY Group**
 Our people have made us the global leader in access solutions. In return, we open doors for them wherever they go. With nearly 61,000 colleagues in more than 70 different countries, we help billions of people experience a more open world. Our innovations make all sorts of spaces – physical and virtual – safer, more secure, and easier to access.
   

  

 As an employer, we value results – not titles, or backgrounds. We empower our people to build their career around their aspirations and our ambitions – supporting them with regular feedback, training, and development opportunities. Our colleagues think broadly about where they can make the most impact, and we encourage them to grow their role locally, regionally, or even internationally.
   

  

 As we welcome new people on board, it’s important to us to have diverse, inclusive teams, and we value different perspectives and experiences.

title: Nordic Territory Sales Leader
description:
We are looking for a proven and experienced Sales leader to join our EMEA Sales organisation and be responsible for driving revenue growth within our Nordic region. Located in Sweden, you will lead a team of Account Executives to exceed sales targets and customer satisfaction objectives. You will be a Thought Leader and spokesperson both internally and externally to the Cyber industry and partner community and you will work collaboratively with our EMEA Sales Leadership team and stakeholders to build and execute the regional Go to Market strategy. This is an opportunity to drive tremendous value in a role that is key to our EMEA growth strategy and Rapid7’s continued advancement and expansion.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Our EMEA Sales organisation serves as a strategic partner for our customers, helping them achieve a more secure digital future. By leveraging the full value of our product portfolio our Sales teams create relevant solutions to meet our customers needs and keep them secure. This position reports to our Senior Director of Sales based in the UK and will lead a team of Account Executives across these regions. Your team will be supported by Sales Engineers, Product Specialists, Channel Managers and Customer Success teams, all with the collective goal of best serving our customer base with best-in-class Cybersecurity solutions and services.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As the Regional Sales Leader for the Nordics, you will manage a team of remote field executives who are responsible for the full sales lifecycle from creating initial interest through to deal closure. You will build out a go-to-market plan of both direct sales and through leveraging channel partnerships and oversee the day to day activities including sales forecasting and pipeline management in a high growth selling environment.
   

  

**In This Role, You Will**
* Create a culture of excellence within your team, consistently meeting or exceeding annual sales and revenue targets by inspiring and leading a team of Account Executives
* Develop the Nordic sales strategy and generate new business opportunities and revenue growth across the region
* Partner with the Go-to-Market leadership team as well as cross-functionally across other departments within Rapid7 to create the ultimate end-to-end customer experience
* Create, develop and build strong and enduring channel partnerships in the region, leveraging your existing network and channel focused experience
* Partner with sales operations and EMEA sales leaders to consistently evaluate sales processes and methodologies and ensure accurate sales forecasting for your region
* Manage the development and performance of your team through on-going coaching. Identify and create development learning tracks with each team member
* Manage teams remotely and locally in the Stockholm office space, while also being willing to travel to meet with large distributed teams throughout EMEA
* Utilise your experience of Enterprise selling in the Nordic region to motivate, inspire and drive the sales and provide mentorship and deal support across the teams
* Establish individual and team budgets, quotas, activity metrics, and forecasts to support company business objectives
* Foster a positive environment of collaboration and professional growth


**The Skills You’ll Bring Include**
* A motivational Sales leader with a proven track record in building and developing high performing and engaged teams to deliver phenomenal results in a matrix environment where cross-functional teamwork is key to success
* 7+ years of sales and high ARR growth experience gained within cyber security SAAS with recurring subscription revenue models
* Proven ability to position multiple product and technology solutions to solve business problems; experience in the Security, Cloud, or IT ecosystem beneficial
* Experience selling into a Large and Enterprise customer base using MEDDIC methodology or a similar sales qualification framework
* Extensive channel sales experience with a strong network and experience in building out a Channel first business
* An entrepreneurial approach with a startup mindset, experienced in growing a region or territory
* A customer centric approach to sales with the ability to drive that throughout your teams, understanding the customers needs and drivers and putting the customer at the forefront of all decision making
* Extremely strong cross-functional skills, with the ability and desire to build relationships with other teams to achieve broader company objectives
* A strong communicator who has excellent consultative selling and interpersonal skills with executive level customers and partners


 We know that the best ideas and solutions come from multi-dimensional teams. That’s because these teams reflect a variety of backgrounds and professional experiences. If you are excited about this role and feel your experience can make an impact, please don’t be shy - apply today.
   

  

**About Rapid7**
 At Rapid7, we are on a mission to create a secure digital world for our customers, our industry, and our communities. We do this by embracing tenacity, passion, and collaboration to challenge what’s possible and drive extraordinary impact.
   

  

 Here, we’re building a dynamic workplace where everyone can have the career experience of a lifetime. We challenge ourselves to grow to our full potential. We learn from our missteps and celebrate our victories. We come to work every day to push boundaries in cybersecurity and keep our 10,000 global customers ahead of whatever’s next.
   

  

 Join us and bring your unique experiences and perspectives to tackle some of the world’s biggest security challenges.

title: Data Engineer
description:
We’re looking for a skilled and motivated Data Engineer to join our dynamic team. In this crucial role, you will be instrumental in fostering a data-driven culture across our organisation, enabling departments to leverage data comprehensively and facilitating data teams in building models, AI, and machine learning solutions.
   

  

 Your expertise will drive the development and maintenance of our state-of-the-art cloud-based data platform, which is central to powering our globally recognized brand. In this role, you will see a direct correlation between your work, company growth, and user satisfaction.
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

* Build and maintain highly scalable and robust data management systems tailored to specific business needs and challenges.
* Ensure systems meet business requirements and industry practices for data integrity, security, and accessibility.
* Build, maintain, develop, test, deploy and enhance our data pipelines and systems
* Collaborate with data team and stakeholders including data architects, Executive and Product from the beginning to the delivery of a project
* Ensure the highest quality of data is made available throughout the entire organisation and systems meeting our SLAs


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE:
   

  

 ESSENTIAL SKILLS:
   

  

* Experience working in an online, gaming, or fast-moving industry
* 3+ years of work experience in data engineers and data platforms
* Must have experience in successfully implementing data-centric applications, such as data warehouses, operational data stores, and data integration projects
* Experience with SQL, ETL, data modelling, and Python
* Proven experience with Bigquery
* Proficient with one or more big data & new data technologies such as DBT, Apache NiFi, Airflow, Kafka


 NICE TO HAVES:
   

  

* Experience from the iGaming industry is meriting


**Who We Are**
 At the core of LeoVegas Group, is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1400 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 11 offices world-wide.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enrol in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


 JOIN US!
   

  

 In our pride, we like to empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait around for things to happen, we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!
   

  

 \*\*As our company working language is English we’d like to see your CV in English please\*\*

title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
description:
**About The Role**
 Kindred's ambition is to be the most insight driven gambling company and in the last few years we've invested heavily in our data and analytics capabilities. We are now at the next stage of our journey, building our capability for developing end-to-end machine learning data products, from research conducted by our Data Scientists through to production applications built by our Machine Learning Engineers.
   

  

 Our Machine Learning Engineers align with and work closely with Data Scientists in cross-functional product teams and are jointly responsible for the development of high-quality data products. We are currently focusing on areas including personalisation and relevancy, and product risk management. Additionally, we are building the core toolset and capability required for our product teams to scale efficiently and iterate rapidly. This includes our Model as a Service deployment platform, developing a feature store for use in both research and production contexts, and building the tooling we need to monitor and test our products.
   

  

**About You**
 We think that to be successful in this role you will be able to demonstrate many of the following attributes:
   

  

* 3-5 years relevant commercial experience.
* Experience working alongside Data Scientists.
* A portfolio of deliveries of ML products.
* Experience deploying models as batch, streams, and as services.
* Excellent Java skills.
* Strong experience deploying containerised applications onto Kubernetes.
* Strong experience using Kafka (including Kafka Streams).
* Experience using Spark.
* Experience using Terraform.
* ML Operations (MLOps) tooling experience including AirFlow and MLFlow.
* Experience in AWS cloud computing.
* Passionate about your personal development.
* Excellent interpersonal skills: able to collaborate, explain complex topics and contribute to the success of cross-functional DS/MLE product teams.
* Ability to deal with and account for uncertainty, with the flexibility to learn by iteration. Proactive.


**In addition, it would be an advantage if you also have:**
* A knowledge of enterprise data concepts, including Data Mesh.
* Solid understanding of statistical modelling and machine learning methodologies.
* AWS certification.
* An interest in mentoring and coaching more junior team member

title: Senior Full-Stack Developer | Shared Tech
description:
**Craft:**
 Technology & Development
   

  

**Job Description:**
**Senior Full Stack Developer - Game Operations Platform**
 We are looking for a versatile full stack developer to shape the future of King’s Game Operations Platform where teams build applications to monitor, grow and monetize some of the most popular mobile games in the world such as Candy Crush Saga! The platform contains a suite of software products designed to provide a central, high-quality, robust and extensible toolset with a consistent and stable user experience.
   

  

 The Game Operations Platform team aims to provide a competitive technical ecosystem that allows internal teams to easily build applications and deliver to the platform without worrying about the infrastructure.
   

  

**Your role within our Kingdom:**
 As a member of the Game Operations Platform team, you will play an important role to influence how technology evolves at King and how King teams develop their internal applications that bring great value to our games. You will work closely with your teammates in an agile environment and you will do product discovery, pair/mob programming and code reviews in GitHub. As a platform developer, you will engage in cross-team collaboration and assist other teams in building applications within our platform.
   

  

**Your responsibilities might include:**
* Develop and maintain King internal tech stack including frontend and backend libraries, frameworks and core APIs
* Improve developer experience, such as self-service tooling, that allow King teams to create and manage their applications
* Develop new features that enhance the experience of our end-users who use the platform to monitor and operate king games
* Co-develop internal applications and libraries with other teams
* Research and drive technology innovations across teams
* Showcasing our work in multiple forums such as presenting in demos, mentoring and coaching other developers through tech workshops and onboarding


**Skills to create thrills:**
* Good experience with React and other frontend frameworks/libraries
* Good experience working with backend services using Java or similar
* Good understanding of RESTful APIs and/or RPC APIs
* Familiar with testing frameworks
* A desire to learn new technologies and programming languages across the stack


**:**
* Knowledge of app development using cloud technologies in GCP or similar
* Enjoys working in a dev-ops culture


**About King**
 At King, we’re Making the World Playful. Heard of Candy Crush? We’re the creators behind it. With game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles, and Malta, we have a 20-year history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry and are on a mission to level-up the little moments for our more than 200 million active monthly users. But we aren’t just crushing it with candies, we’re also behind Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch, Pet Rescue and loads of other sweet games. As a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, King is part of Activision Blizzard, which was recently acquired by Microsoft.
   

  

**A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes**
 King strives to be a place where everyone can be their most authentic self. We recognize that diversity, equity and inclusion is a vital and continuous conversation, and that change only happens when we all come together. It’s our mission to build a diverse and inclusive Kingdom for our people, players, and community.
   

  

**Making the World Playful**
 Making the World Playful is our mission – it’s the thread that connects our people, our players, and our passion for our games. Let’s face it, who doesn’t love a bit of fun?
   

  

 Kingsters are seriously playful: creative thinkers who balance art and science to bring moments of magic to millions daily. But our players aren’t the only ones that can level-up. We’re always looking for ways to champion each other and make what’s already great, even better.
   

  

 So, if this feels like a fun way to spend your days, and you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful.
   

  

 Applications need to be in English.
   

  

 Discover King at careers.king.com

title: Solutions Architect - Dynamics 365
description:
Som Solutions Architect kommer du att samarbeta nära dina kollegor inom Enterprise Systems Management-teamet och spela en nyckelroll i att designa och implementera skräddarsydda lösningar för olika affärsintressenter. Du kommer att säkerställa att affärsstrategier stöds och att affärsbehoven uppfylls genom levererade lösningar. Du kommer att främja arkitektoniska metoder för organisationsbehov och utmaningar samt förklara val och skäl bakom dem.
   

  

**Du kommer också att leda** 
 och handleda utvecklingsteam i implementering av lösningar Hålla dig uppdaterad med Dynamics 365-uppdateringar och branschtrender för att informera om lösningarnas design och optimering Designa effektiva tekniska lösningar med huvudfokus på att utnyttja färdiga funktioner, som följer arkitektoniska och säkerhetsmässiga standarder
   

  

**Om dig**
 Vi tror att du har starka analytiska och problemlösningsförmågor. Du är utmärkt på att kommunicera och kan klargöra komplexa tekniska begrepp för icke-tekniska målgrupper.
   

  

**Krav**
* Omfattande erfarenhet av att design, implementera och anpassa Microsoft Dynamics 365-lösningar
* Starka tekniska färdigheter inom Microsoft Power Platform
* Bevisad expertis inom lösningarkitektur, inklusive systemintegration, datamodellering, säkerhet och skalbarhet


 Meriterande:
   

  

* Erfarenhet med Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement-plattformen
* Certifieringar inom Microsoft
* En teknisk universitets- eller högskoleexamen


**Placering: remote men 1 dag/veckan i Göteborg
   

  

 Omfattning: 100%**
**Språk: Svenska och engelska**
**Vänligen ansök snarast med:**
* Ditt uppdaterade CV
* Timpris (inkl. omkostnader)
* Tillgänglighetsdatum
* En kort motivering varför du är lämplig uppdraget.

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer
description:
Cloud innovations change the gaming industry landscape every day, adding new capabilities, allowing new scenarios, and redefining the category. Our mission is to provide a reliable, and easy way to develop and operate game servers. Within EA, the Game Server Hosting group builds the important game server infrastructure that underpins EA's current generation of multiplayer games and fuels development of the next wave. We are looking for a Software Engineer to join the team driving our game server platform forward and help ship EA's next amazing multiplayer game.
   

  

**What a Senior Software Engineer does on EA's Game Server Hosting team:**
 Reporting To The Director Of Engineering, Game Server Hosting, Your Primary Responsibility Will Be To Influence The Architecture And Design Of Our Containerized Software And Services Infrastructure, Then Guide The Delivery Of Those Designs. Most Of Your Time Will Be Spent Working With Your Teammates, Planning And Creating High-quality Services And Systems That Power And Support EA Games And Their Dedicated Game Servers. You Will Contribute To The Growth Of The Entire Team Through Active Participation Processes Such As Mentoring And Code Reviews, Promoting Best Practices Both Internally To The Team And Externally With Partners. Here Are Some Other Activities We Expect Of You
   

  

* Develop creative solutions that address customer requests, deliver new features and fix defects
* Collaborate with customers and product owners across teams and time zones to create designs that balance priorities and requirements and can be broken down into clear execution plans
* Develop well-tested code that follows peer-reviewed coding standards
* Guide the debugging of complex and hard to reproduce problems and contribute to post-mortems for unsuccessful releases
* Communicate, and enforce our quality processes, coding best practices
* Enhance EA's engineering capabilities through tracking of industry, segment, and technology transformations
* Support and mentor other team members through advice, coaching and educational opportunities and impart, design, and debugging skills to them


**The Next Great EA Software Engineer Needs To Have**
* 10+ years fullstack commercial development experience
* Expertise with one or more web development frameworks - React, Angular, VueJS
* Expertise developing RESTful web services or gRPC services at Internet consumer scale
* 3+ years hands-on domain experience in cloud operational infrastructure and services
* Experience working on high traffic services and scalable systems, multi-threaded design with a complete understanding of an OO language
* Experience working within one or more public cloud providers (AWS, Azure, GCP)
* Firsthand use of scaling technologies such as memcached, queuing
* First hand experience in all phases of a modern service development lifecycle, including requirement definition, architecture, technical development, debugging, testing, troubleshooting, product release, and live operation.


**Bonus Experience Points**
* Proficiency with Golang
* Experience with Kubernetes as an orchestration system for large numbers of workloads (1000+ pods in multiple regions)
* Familiarity with game engines and game software development processes
* Engineering Collaboration software - JIRA, GitLab, GitHub, or Confluence

title: Enhetsansvarig till Gransångarevägen
location: Upplands Väsby och Sollentuna, Stockholm County, Sweden
description:
Gransångarevägens gruppboende ligger i Sjöberg och är ett boende för personer med olika funktionsvariationer, t ex intellektuell funktionsnedsättning, fysisk funktionsvariation och/eller förvärvad hjärnskada. Nu söker vi en engagerad medarbetare till vårt team!
   

  

**SOLOM söker enhetsansvarig stödpedagog inom LSS**
 Brinner du för LSS och söker en ny karriärmöjlighet? Är du vår framtida ledare? Till en
   

  

 helt ny roll som enhetsansvarig söker SOLOM nu dig med tidigare erfarenhet av
   

  

 arbetsledande roll som vill vara med och utveckla vår LSS-organisation med fokus på
   

  

 kund och kvalitet. Nu finns en unik chans att vara med att leda, utveckla och kvalitetssäkra två LSS verksamheter som är belägna på samma gata, mittemot varandra.
   

  

**Beskrivning av tjänsten**
 Tjänsten som enhetsansvarig innebär förutom det verksamhetsnära arbetet som
   

  

 stödpedagog, även en arbetsledarfunktion inom ekonomi-, personal-, och kvalitetsfrågor.
   

  

 Du har en viktig roll som verksamhetschefens förlängda arm i verksamheterna.
   

  

 Din främsta roll som enhetsansvarig är att arbetsleda och delta aktivt i det dagliga
   

  

 omsorgsarbetet tillsammans med dina kollegor. Genom att vara en förebild i verksamheterna och arbeta efter våra värdeord Glädje, Engagemang och Respekt skapar du en positiv arbetsmiljö varje dag för grupperna. För rätt person finns möjlighet till intern karriärsutveckling.
   

  

**Tjänsten innebär**
 Som enhetsansvarig stödpedagog ingår du i ett professionellt team som ger stöd till personer med bland annat IF, autism, psykisk ohälsa samt utmanande beteende som kan leda till hot och våld situationer.Vi arbetar alltid utifrån den boendes behov, önskemål och utifrån dennes självbestämmande. Som stödpedagog arbetar du aktivt för att säkra en hög kvalité i driften och omsorgen. Du bidrar med en fördjupad pedagogisk kunskap inom funktionsvariationsområdet och tar därmed extra ansvar för frågor som handlar om det pedagogiska förhållnings- och arbetssättet med kunden i fokus.
   

  

 Som stödpedagog ingår du i verksamhetens baspersonal och du deltar i det dagliga omvårdnadsarbetet med ansvar att metodutveckla och handleda dina kollegor.
   

  

 Som enhetsansvarig säkerställer du även följsamhet till verksamhetens arbetssätt och metoder.
   

  

 Det ekonomiska ansvaret omfattar bland annat fakturahantering, inköp, redovisning och att du är väl insatt i verksamhetens budget.
   

  

 Kvalitetsansvaret omfattar bland annat uppföljning och säkerställande av dokumentation (så som genomförandeplaner, riskbedömningar med mera) och samordning kring och deltagande i samverkansmöten.
   

  

 Arbetsledning omfattar bland annat bemanning, tidrapportering, upprättande av
   

  

 personalscheman, introduktioner, att stötta ombudsfunktioner på verksamheten samt
   

  

 rekrytering av timvikarier. I arbetsledaransvaret ingår även uppföljning av verksamhetens
   

  

 egenkontroller och du rapporterar direkt till verksamhetschef. I rollen ingår även kontakt med anhöriga och dokumentation.
   

  

 Utöver schemalagd arbetstid i driften finns avsatt tid för adminstrations-arbete. Detta möjliggör att du på så sätt ser och kan kartlägga de boendes hela dagar och alla medarbetares metodutveckling.
   

  

**Din profil**
 Du har eftergymnasial specialisering inom funktionsvariationsområdet t ex "Stödpedagog inom LSS" som omfattar minst 200 YH-poäng eller 60 högskolepoäng (eller kombination som motsvarar minst två terminers heltidsstudier). Du har stor erfarenhet av att arbeta med målgruppen och känner dig bekväm i att handleda dina kollegor.
   

  

 För att passa i denna tjänst tror vi att du är en person som brinner för verksamhetens
   

  

 målgrupp och gärna entusiasmerar dina kollegor.
   

  

 Vi vill att du:
   

  

* är självständig och trygg i ditt arbete
* känner stolthet och lojalitet gentemot ditt uppdrag och organisationen
* har ett prestigelöst och professionellt förhållningssätt och kan skapa goda relationer


 internt och externt med exempelvis anhöriga, myndigheter och beställare
   

  

* är flexibel och har lätt för att anpassa dig till ändrade omständigheter
* har systemvana och med lätthet sätter dig in i nya system
* har hög ansvarskänsla och ekonomiskt sinne och förståelse för helheten samt förstår
* konsekvenser kopplat till bemanning, såväl ekonomiska som kvalitativa.


 För oss är det viktigt att du har ett brinnande intresse för arbetet. Du är lyhörd och flexibel med det våra boenden behöver stöd och hjälp med. Målet är att alla boenden ska kunna leva ett så självständigt liv som möjligt. Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet.
   

  

**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
* Kontinuerlig fortbildning
* Nätverksträffar med andra i samma roll
* Möjlighet till intern karriärsutveckling


 SOLOM erbjuder en arbetsplats med glädje, engagerade medarbetare, god gemenskap och närvarande ledare. Vi har självklart kollektivavtal och erbjuder förmåner som generöst friskvårdsbidrag och Edenred-kortet (subventionerade lunchkuponger).
   

  

 Om SOLOM SOLOM är Sollentuna kommuns största utförare inom äldreomsorg och LSS. Vi bildades 2013 och är något så unikt som ett kommunägt vård- och omsorgsföretag. SOLOM är en av Sollentunas största arbetsgivare och finns idag på ett 30-tal platser i kommunen. Med glädje, engagemang och respekt arbetar vi varje dag för att hjälpa våra kunder att ha huvudrollen i sina liv. Läs mer om oss på www.solom.se Utdrag från Polisens belastningsregister kommer att efterfrågas i samband med anställningserbjudande.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidare med provanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Sollentuna | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/39 | Kontakt: Anne Maddock 08-12824000, | Publicerat: 2024-05-28 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-06-30

title: Senior Engineer Modelling and Simulation
description:
Jobbify är en jobbplattform för vassa kandidater.
  
För kunds räkning har vi publicerat denna annons, vill du komma i kontakt med den slutgiltiga arbetsgivaren kan du klicka dig vidare till annonsen:
  
The HYBRIT initiative was launched in 2016 by SSAB, LKAB and Vattenfall with the aim of creating a fossil-free value chain from mine to fossil-free steel, with fossil-free pellets, fossil-free electricity and hydrogen. The aim of the initiative is to phase out the use of coal and to virtually eliminate carbon dioxide emissions in the steel industry, corresponding to about 10% of Sweden's total CO2 emissions.
  
On August 31, 2020, the pilot plant for direct reduction of iron ore with hydrogen was commissioned and in August 2022, the pilot plant for storage of fossil-free hydrogen was commissioned. The HYBRIT technology, validated and optimized over several years of development with very promising results, will now be used and further developed in industrial applications on a larger scale.
  
**Read more at:** www.hybritdevelopment.se/en
  
Position
  
  

As Senior Engineer Modelling and Simulation you will work with the development of the Hybrit process for fossil free iron and steel production. Process development is ongoing at the pilot plant for direct reduction of iron in Luleå. At the same time, industrialization projects are ongoing to commercialize the process.
  
  

In a fast-paced and dynamic R&D environment you will apply your skills to the modelling of chemical and physical processes to simulate key steps in the hydrogen-based iron and steel production chain. Together with your colleagues in the modelling team you are expected to take lead in the planning and execution of activities such as development of models and modelling tools and apply them in simulation. You will work with data from lab experiments and pilot trials, producing validated models that form the basis for high fidelity simulations used in process design and scale-up. Other aspects of your work will include developing applications to support plant operations and efficiency. Simulators for operator training and tools for process monitoring and control are some examples. As part of the modelling team, you will collaborate actively with specialists from different areas such as research, process engineering, product development, digitalization, automation and IT. Working teams typically include Hybrit colleagues as well as external partners.
  
  

Typical responsibilities and tasks
  
  

Develop models and perform simulations with focus on the process for direct reduction of iron with hydrogen.
  
  

Develop tools to support plant operations and efficiency.
  
  

Actively participate and collaborate in projects to industrialize the Hybrit process.
  
  

Share and document models and results.
  
  

Set up and maintain hardware and software solutions required for simulation and storage of results.
  
  

Qualifications and experience
  
  

MSc or PhD in engineering or physical sciences.
  
  

3-5 years of experience in modelling and simulation in chemical or metallurgical process engineering, reaction engineering or similar applications. Proficiency with process control is a plus.
  
  

Proficiency with process modelling software, equation-based modelling and programming.
  
  

Experience from industrial R&D or related technical consultancy.
  
  

Excellent writing and communication skills in English.
  
  

Location
  
  

The position will be based in Luleå or in Stockholm.
  
  

The Hybrit offer
  
  

You will be involved and play a crucial role in developing a fossil-free value chain.
  
  

You will have the opportunity to make a difference and contribute to an exciting transformation journey towards a sustainable future.
  
  

You will be part of a company where the culture is professional but with a familiar and close collaboration.
  
  

A journey in learnings
  
  

Top quality equipment and new technology
  
  

Opportunity to work with like-minded individuals in a modern and fast-paced environment.
  
  

As an employee at Hybrit, you can expect a safe and good working environment. We care about our employees and prioritize balanced working conditions. We have collective agreements and generous benefits such as health insurance, wellness allowance, occupational pension and pension advise, occupational health care, allowances for health care and medicine, as well as visits to a physiotherapist etc. We have 30 days of vacation and a reduction in working hours.
  
  

We work project based, digital and adapt to new circumstances fast. We empower smart, passionate, curious minds to collaborate, innovate and work together to create something that will make a real difference.
  
  

We hope you´re interested in joining our journey towards a fossil free future.

title: Fullstack Engineer
description:
At Anyfin HQ, located in the heart of Stockholm, we're on a mission to revolutionize the financial landscape. By empowering individuals with smart tools, we're reshaping the narrative of financial health worldwide. Our vision is simple yet profound: to enhance the financial well-being of every individual, one step/debt at a time.
   

  

**About Us**
 Since our start in 2017, we've empowered countless Swedes, Finns, Germans and Norwegians to reclaim control of their finances by saving millions through the refinancing of expensive consumer credits. But our ambitions are higher. With new markets, innovative tools, and groundbreaking products on the horizon, we're in constant pursuit of new avenues to elevate people's financial circumstances. And to achieve these lofty goals, we need minds and hearts as passionate as ours. And that my friend, is where you (yes YOU) come in.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
 As a Software Engineer at Anyfin, you'll step into a startup environment brimming with diversity and rapid evolution. Collaborate with like-minded colleagues who are driven, supportive, and embrace change with open arms (it will happen no matter if you do or not so you might as well roll with it). You'll join a team comprising senior, mid-level, and junior developers, fostering a culture of continuous learning and knowledge sharing. Every day presents a new challenge, offering you the opportunity to contribute to something truly monumental from your very first pull request.
   

  

**Your Responsibilities**
* Utilize Node.js and React as your primary tools, alongside TypeScript, GraphQL, Postgres, and React Native.
* Tackle intricate coding challenges, crafting new products and enhancing existing features.
* Engage in a spectrum of tasks, from refining processing systems to enhancing customer-facing web and native apps.
* Actively participate in system and product design, fuelled by an open and inquisitive mindset.
* Collaborate within autonomous cross-functional teams, shaping product and business strategies.
* Share insights, best practices, and guidelines, fostering a culture of collective growth.


**Who You Are**
* Proficient in TypeScript, with a strong preference for Node.js and React.
* Possess a minimum of 3 years of professional experience, with a bonus for familiarity with React Native.
* Strike a balance between perfection and pragmatism in your code.
* Advocate for clean, readable code as the cornerstone of our foundational work.
* Embrace diversity and inclusivity, valuing individuals regardless of gender, age, sexual orientation, or religion.
* Additional skills in Python, Go, SQL, and GraphQL are advantageous.
* Experience in the financial sector and a background in computer science are desirable but not mandatory.


**Why Join Us?**
 We promise that you will be challenged, pushed to develop your skill set and get the opportunity to work alongside amazing and smart colleagues. While we've had a good run so far it is what lies ahead that excites everyone that works here, and we are just getting started. Then there is the compensation package, centrally located cozy office, extra time off on your birthday and a bunch of other benefits as well. But we will get to all that in due time.
   

  

 Ready to embark on this exciting journey? We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

 We work from the office 4 days a week. Simply because we believe innovation and collaboration happen when we meet in person.
   

  

 Unfortunately we will not be offering relocation support for this position.
   

  

 Anyfin is a Swedish fintech on a mission to improve financial well-being and revolutionize debt management. We empower consumers to track all of their credits and loans in one place and reduce the costs of high-interest credits.

title: Frontend Engineer - ZEOS Logistics Solutions (all genders)
description:
**THE ROLE & THE TEAM**
 Over the last few years, we learned that solving fulfillment-related challenges for the good of our customers helps us to fuel the growth of our platform. With more partners in the Multi-Channel Fulfilment (MCF) program joining our platform, we have been developing and testing additional further fulfillment services tailored to their needs.
   

  

 The Connected Network department is responsible for all partner-facing Zalando Logistics Solutions. By unifying and collaborating these services under a single umbrella, we provide a more holistic approach to delivering the optimal fulfillment solution to meet our partners' needs and leverage common services to enable partner program growth. As a Senior Frontend Software Engineer in Connected Network, you will design, develop and operate business-critical applications for our partners and internal stakeholders that process tens of thousands of events per second powering the critical partner-facing backend APIs and web applications of the partner fulfillment domain. You will work with tools and technologies such as Typescript, React, JavaScript, AWS, and Kubernetes in building high-performant, low-latency systems to create an impact on customers and partners.
   

  

**INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN**
 At Zalando, our vision is to be the starting point for fashion - one that is inclusive by design.
   

  

 We only assess candidates based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We welcome
   

  

 applications from people of all gender identities, sexual orientations, personal expressions,
   

  

 racial identities, ethnicities, religious beliefs, and disability statuses. We only want to know
   

  

 why you’re great for this role, so please avoid including your picture, age, and marital status
   

  

 in your CV as well.
   

  

 We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Please feel free to inform us of
   

  

 any accommodations you may need, so we can best support and assist you throughout the
   

  

 hiring process.
   

  

 do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy
   

  

 https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion
   

  

 Our employee resource groups
   

  

 https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion/our-employee-resource-groups
   

  

**WHY YOU SHOULD BE INTERESTED...**
* Working on solution planning, design, and implementation by collaborating closely


 with stakeholders and teams that own dependencies
   

  

  

* Working like a startup in an agile environment & taking ownership of the whole


 development cycle - from architecture design to testing to implementation &
   

  

 maintenance.
   

  

  

* Share your knowledge with your colleagues and help them grow their technical skills.
* Work closely with stakeholders, product team, and design counterparts
* Ensure system-reliability engineering and technical compliance


**WE’D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF YOU HAVE...**
* 3+ years of professional experience as a Frontend Software Engineer
* Thorough understanding of microservices and REST APIs as well as extensive


 experience with React, Typescript, Webpack, JavaScript, CSS/HTML.
   

  

  

* Experience in scripting and building CLIs is desired.
* Experience with implementing tracking, GTM, and third-party integrations.
* Experience with micro front ends is a plus.
* Experience with Design Systems is a plus.
* Experience with other development languages is a plus
* Knowledge about engineering practices that lead to writing well-tested quality code.
* Eagerness to read code, pair with other engineers on refactoring and implementation


 of new features
   

  

  

* Familiarity with AWS and Kubernetes is a plus.
* "You build it, you run it" approach experience managing features end-to-end, from


 developing to deploying to monitoring and incident support.
   

  

  

* You have good communication skills to work effectively with colleagues, moderate


 team meetings and find creative solutions to complex problems as a team.
   

  

  

* Previous experience in the Customer Portal domain is a bonus.
* Nice to have experience with Python or Java


**Zalando Benefits**
 Zalando provides a range of benefits. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more
   

  

**About Zalando**
 about what we offer.
   

  

 It’s the perfect time to join Zalando on our journey, from being a pioneer in the world of
   

  

 e-commerce to the starting point for fashion in Europe. We connect customers, brands, and
   

  

 partners across 23 markets.
   

  

 Help us drive digital and sustainable solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising, and
   

  

 research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 46 million active customers through a
   

  

 team of diverse skill sets, cultural backgrounds, and interests.
   

  

 Our values https //jobs.zalando.com/en/our-founding-mindset
   

  

 do.More - our sustainability strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/sustainability
   

  

 Follow us on Instagram instagram.com/insidezalando

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
At Optimizely, we're on a mission to help people unlock their digital potential. We do that by reinventing how marketing and product teams work to create and optimize digital experiences across all channels. With Optimizely One, our industry-first operating system for marketers, we offer teams flexibility and choice to build their stack their way with our fully SaaS, fully decoupled, and highly composable solution.
   

  

 We are proud to help more than 10,000 businesses, including H&M, PayPal, Zoom, and Toyota, enrich their customer lifetime value, increase revenue and grow their brands. Our innovation and excellence have earned us numerous recognitions as a leader by industry analysts such as Gartner, Forrester, and IDC, reinforcing our role as a trailblazer in MarTech.
   

  

 At our core, we believe work is about more than just numbers -- it's about the people. Our culture is dynamic and constantly evolving, shaped by every employee, their actions and their stories. With over 1500 Optimizers spread across 12 global locations, our diverse team embodies the "One Optimizely" spirit, emphasizing collaboration and continuous improvement, while fostering a culture where every voice is heard and valued.
   

  

**Introduction**
 We are looking for a Stockholm-based Senior Software Engineer for our Commerce team, to help us shape the future experiences of Optimizely’s e-commerce offerings.
   

  

 Ideally you bring experience of building APIs and services. You are self-motivated and like to collaborate with your colleagues to find the best solution that solves the problem, considering architecture, cost of development and cost of ownership. You are comfortable with working in a fast-moving agile environment and working closely with User Experience Designers, Product Managers, and other stakeholders.
   

  

 You will be collaborating with developers distributed across the world. Proficiency in written and spoken English is a strong requirement.
   

  

**As a Senior Software Engineer, You Will..**
* Design, architect and implement simple, secure, scalable, maintainable, and cost-effective software solutions.
* Ensure product quality by developing and applying thorough automated testing techniques.
* Contribute to architecture and design discussions within your agile team as well as across teams and products.
* Contribute to project planning including requirements elicitation, design, task grooming and scoping.
* Mentor and share with other engineers and team members.
* Pursue growth by maintaining an awareness of the state of technology, engineering techniques, and best practices.


**About You**
* You have at least a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or similar, or corresponding level of relevant education
* You have 7+ years of experience working professionally with modern development practices.
* You are strong in software design and engineering concepts, including but not limited to object-oriented analysis, design, and programming.
* You are approaching expert level knowledge of the .NET development platform.
* You are knowledgeable in the development and operational aspects of cloud-based software.
* You are highly proficient in spoken and written English.
* You are a team player who enjoys solving problems together, and a great communicator.
* You have an understanding and interest for building and maintaining large applications as well as extensible libraries/frameworks/APIs.
* Ideally you have significant experience designing and building large, modular, applications with continuous releases that quickly adapt to user needs.


**Education**
 Bachelor’s Degree (Computer Science or engineering preferred) or equivalent work experience
   

  

 Optimizely is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Optimizely is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

title: Data Engineer
description:
**About The Role**
 At LeoVegas, data is essential to all our decision making needs regarding customer behavior, marketing, social media, product development and discovery of new markets.
   

  

 The Data Engineering Team is responsible for gathering and processing this information into consumable insights using Big Data technologies.
   

  

 As our Data Engineer you will join a team of eight data engineers and two data quality engineers that work with the latest technologies available inside the Google GCP ecosystem.
   

  

 You will be responsible for elaborating new solutions, implementing and maintaining batch, near real-time and real time ETL pipelines having quality, performance and costs optimization in mind. You will be collaborating with the wider team to optimize data flows, helping business records to integrate and support in the data pipelines.
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

* Building the ETL pipelines out of complex and high-volume datasets for both batch and streaming
* Helping business records to integrate and support in the data pipelines
* Integrate, ingest and help improve the data into the Data Warehouse in the Google cloud environment
* Work on adding new features to the system
* Update cloud components


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:
   

  

* ETL data pipelines development
* Airflow, BigQuery, Dataflow
* Java SE, Python and SQL
* Sound software engineering practises around test automation, CI/CD, version control
* Knowledge about data modeling, data access, and data storage techniques


 NICE TO HAVE:
   

  

* Cloud migration experience (Azure / AWS)
* iGaming industry experience


**Who We Are**
 At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1400 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 11 offices worldwide.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enroll in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


 JOIN US!
   

  

 In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!
   

  

 \*\*As our company working language is English, we’d like to see your CV in English, please\*\*

title: AI-experter
description:
**Är du redo att forma framtiden genom att omvandla information till värde?**
 På Sogeti är vi övertygade om att information är den nya valutan och vi söker nu efter passionerade AI-profiler med djup teknisk kompetens och en vilja att ständigt lära sig nya saker.
   

  

 Sogeti strävar efter att hjälpa våra kunder genom både strategiska och operativa förbättringar. Vi tror på att utmana befintliga lösningar för att göra dem effektivare och att använda de senaste teknologierna för att skapa värde genom moderna tillämpningar som GenAI.
   

  

 Sogeti söker AI-experter som vill vara med och driva området i Stockholm i samarbete med kollegor i övriga landet och världen. Vi söker dig som är nyfiken, tekniskt skicklig och driven att förbättra och effektivisera verksamheter.
   

  

 Vi vill att du ska vara en lagspelare som är bra på att arbeta i team men även på att leverera på egen hand. Du är utåtriktad och gillar att hålla dig uppdaterad om de senaste teknologierna. Att hjälpa kunder att identifiera användningsfall och skapa största möjliga värde är något du brinner för.
   

  

* Tillämpa stora språkmodeller (LLM) på specifika affärsproblem för att extrahera, bearbeta, klassificera och härleda insikter från ostrukturerade datamängder.
* Utveckla domän- eller uppgiftsspecifika språkmodeller för affärsproblem när befintliga modeller inte kan användas
* Utvärdera prestandan för maskininlärningsmodeller och ge rekommendationer för förbättringar
* Hålla dig uppdaterad kring kärnteknologier inom NLP och generativ AI
* Arbeta i tvärfunktionella team och ta gemensamt ägarskap och ansvar för planering, arbete, kvalitet och leverans.
* Agera mentor till juniora teammedlemmar för att bidra till en miljö där de får utvecklas genom stöd och support.


**Krav**
* Akademisk examen inom Data Science, Data, Machine Learning, Theoretical Linguistics eller motsvarande.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av stora språkmodeller (GPT, XLNet, T5, etc.).
* God erfarenhet av att använda moderna NLP-verktyg och bibliotek som spaCy, Hugging Face Transformers.
* Goda kunskaper i Python-utveckling inklusive bibliotek som NumPy, SciPy och erfarenhet av SQL.
* Duktig på att kommunicera och lära ut, förmåga att förklara tekniska koncept för icke-tekniska intressenter.
* Flytande i svenska och engelska, både skriftligt och muntligt.
* Praktisk erfarenhet av att arbeta med både on-prem och molnplattformar, MS Azure är meriterande.
* Kunskap och erfarenhet av vektordatabaser som Pinecone, Milvus eller Weaviate är meriterande.


**Capgemini och Sogeti utsedda till ”Årets AI-Partner” i Sverige**
 Läs mer här!
   

  

 Om du är redo för en spännande utmaning och vill vara en del av vår framgångsrika resa, skicka in din ansöka n.
   

  

**Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till Sogeti-familjen!**

title: Quantitative Engineer
description:
**About Kambi**
 Kambi Group plc is a leading B2B provider of premium sports betting services to licensed gaming operators. Our services provide an end-to-end solution for operators wanting to launch a standalone Sportsbook or bolster their existing offering with an innovative sports betting product. From front-end user interface to customer intelligence, risk management and odds compiling, all built on our in-house developed software, we strive to deliver the ultimate service and solution to our partners.
   

  

 Our vision is to create the world’s leading sports betting experiences, together with our partners.
   

  

**About Tzeract:**
 Tzeract is a pioneering sports betting AI pricing company, operating as an agile startup within the larger ecosystem of Kambi Group ( https://kambi.com/ ). Our mission is to revolutionize the sports betting industry by leveraging cutting-edge technology and advanced analytics to enable the next generation of sports betting experiences. With a focus on both historical and real-time sports data, we're building systems that outperform the market and deliver value to our users.
   

  

 To know more about us - https://tzeract.com/
   

  

**Role Overview:**
 We're on the hunt for a brilliant ML/Quant Engineer with a deep understanding of mathematics and statistics, ready to tackle the challenges of sports data with sophisticated models and algorithms. This role is crucial for developing and refining our predictive models that are central to our AI-driven betting strategies. You'll collaborate closely with data engineers and scientists, bringing a mathematical lens to enhance our algorithms and strategies.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Design, develop, and implement advanced mathematical models and machine learning algorithms for predictive analytics in sports betting.
* Conduct rigorous statistical analysis to understand data patterns, validate models, and enhance prediction accuracy.
* Work with large-scale, real-time, and historical sports data sets, applying quantitative techniques to extract actionable insights.
* Collaborate with the engineering team to integrate algorithms into our production systems, ensuring they operate efficiently at scale.
* Keep abreast of the latest developments in quantitative finance, machine learning, and sports analytics, applying them to improve our models and strategies.
* Communicate complex quantitative analyses and concepts to non-technical team members to inform strategy decisions.


**Qualifications:**
* Master's or PhD in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, or a related quantitative field.
* Strong background in mathematical modeling, statistical analysis, and machine learning algorithms.
* Proficiency in Python, with experience in libraries like NumPy, Pandas, SciPy, and scikit-learn.
* Familiarity with TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar deep learning frameworks.
* Experience in quantitative finance, algorithmic trading, or a related field is highly desirable.
* Ability to translate complex mathematical concepts into practical applications.
* Passionate about sports and leveraging data to solve complex problems in sports betting.
* Excellent problem-solving abilities and a commitment to high-quality output.


**Why Join Us:**
* Impact the sports betting market with your work on state-of-the-art algorithms and models.
* Collaborate with a team of passionate professionals in a culture that celebrates innovation and results.
* Enjoy a competitive compensation package, including bonuses, health benefits, and flexible working conditions.
* Continuous learning opportunities to stay at the forefront of technology and quantitative research. How to Apply:


 Send your resume, a brief cover letter explaining why you're a good fit for this role, we're excited to hear from you and explore how you can contribute to our team!

title: Android Utvecklare till B3 Mobile
description:
B3 Mobile är dotterbolaget inom koncernen som är
 ***experter***
 på apputveckling. Android, iOS, Kotlin, Swift, Java - Vi kan det!
   

  

 Vi söker dig som vill ta nästa steg i din karriär. Du kanske har arbetat med Androidutveckling i några år och känner dig redo för något nytt. Håll i hatten, för hos B3 Mobile arbetar vi med några av världens mest spännande kunder baserade både i Stockholm och på andra sidan Atlanten.
   

  

 I rollen som Androidutvecklare kommer du att arbeta tillsammans med ett kompetent och passionerat gäng utvecklare, UX-designers och projektledare både in-house och ute hos kund. Vi jobbar primärt med Kotlin men erfarenhet av Java är alltid bra.
   

  

**Vi letar efter dig som:**
* Har en bakgrund som civilingenjör eller motsvarande
* Besitter goda kunskaper i Svenska, både i tal & skrift
* Har 3+ års erfarenhet som Androidutvecklare
* Har stor erfarenhet av programmering för Androidplattformen med Kotlin och Android Studio
* Arbetar med fokus på slutanvändarnas upplevelse
* Levererar högkvalitativ kod som är ren och lätt att förstå och utöka
* Är proaktiv och kommer med förslag på lösningar inom de projekt du arbetar med


**Intresset ska självfallet vara ömsesidigt. Det här erbjuder vi dig:**
* Möjlighet att arbeta med tekniskt utmanande lösningar hos många olika kunder med ett stort antal användare.
* Flexibilitet & en hybrid modell där vi ses på kontoret en dag i veckan för att träffa kollegor, jobba tillsammans och lära oss nya saker.
* En snabbrörlig, rolig och trygg arbetsplats där vi strävar efter balans både i arbetslivet och livet i stort.
* Friskvårdsbidrag att lägga på gymkort, padel, massage eller andra aktiviteter.
* Wellness satsning för att säkerställa ditt välmående på arbetsplatsen.


 Vi jobbar mycket med kompetensutveckling, du kommer att vidareutvecklas och utforska de senaste teknikerna tillsammans med hela teamet. Du får ett stort ansvar och arbetar både individuellt och i större team. Vi tror att vår energi och nyfikenhet, vårt sätt att välkomna olikheter och vår vilja att dela med oss av våra erfarenheter bidrar till att skapa en miljö där alla, inklusive du, kan växa och utvecklas.
   

  

 För mer information kontakta Max Svensson, konsult på B3 Mobile, på max.svensson@b3.se alternativt VD Camilla Landén på camilla.landen@b3.se
